str2: Accusative case of charis as preposition; through favor of, i.e. On account of.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and leipo; to leave behind; by implication, to forsake.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Crete. Of uncertain derivation; Crete, an island in the Mediterranean.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From epi and a derivative of orthos; to straighten further, i.e. arrange additionally.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: A primary verb; to leave, i.e. to fail or be absent.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From kata and histemi; to place down, i.e. to designate, constitute, convoy.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To give orders to, prescribe, arrange. From dia and tasso; to arrange thoroughly, i.e. institute, prescribe, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
